txt_en: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
txt_cn: 困难能磨练心志，正如劳动能强壮体魄。
author: Seneca

txt_en: Kites rise highest against the wind, not with it.
txt_cn: 风筝逆风才能高飞——而不是顺风。
author: 温斯顿·丘吉尔

txt_en: There is an applause superior to that of the multitudes: one's own.
txt_cn: 有一种掌声，比大众的掌声更优裕：那就是你自己给自己鼓的掌。
author: Elizabeth Elton Smith

txt_en: Change the way you look at things and the things you look at change.
txt_cn: 改变你看待事物的方式，你所看到的事物也会改变。
author: Wayne W. Dyer

txt_en: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
txt_cn: 相信自己能成功，你就已经成功了一半。
author: Theodore Roosevelt

txt_en: A clear vision, backed by definite plans, gives you a tremendous feeling of confidence and personal power.
txt_cn: 一个清晰的愿景，加以明确计划的支持，会给你极大的信心和个人力量。
author: Brian Tracy

txt_en: When you finally go back to your old hometown, you find it wasn't the old home you missed but your childhood.
txt_cn: 当你终于重归故里，你会发现自己思念的，不是故乡，而是童年。
author: Sam Ewing

txt_en: Goodness is the only investment that never fails.
txt_cn: 善良是唯一不会失败的投资。
author: Henry David Thoreau

txt_en: If you want the best the world has to offer, offer the world your best.
txt_cn: 若想得到世界上最好的东西，先向世界展现最好的你。
author: Neale Donald Walsch

txt_en: Neither abstinence nor excess ever renders man happy.
txt_cn: 不论是节制还是过度都不能给人带来快乐。
author: 伏尔泰

txt_en: A positive attitude will have positive results because attitudes are contagious.
txt_cn: 积极的态度会带来积极的结果，因为态度是具有感染力的。
author: Zig Ziglar

txt_en: Whatever is worth doing at all is worth doing well.
txt_cn: 任何值得做的事，都值得将其做好。
author: Philip Stanhope

txt_en: The more we do, the more we can do.
txt_cn: 我们做的越多，能做的也就越多。
author: William Hazlitt

txt_en: I'm not telling you it is going to be easy, I'm telling you it's going to be worth it.
txt_cn: 我不会告诉你这个过程很容易。我只会说，这一切都是值得的。
author: Art Williams

txt_en: Keep a little fire burning; however small, however hidden.
txt_cn: 让心中的火苗一直燃烧吧，不管那有多微弱，不管藏得有多深。
author: Cormac McCarthy

txt_en: Nothing you wear is more important than your smile.
txt_cn: 不管如何穿戴，都不比带上你的微笑。
author: Connie Stevens

txt_en: An aim in life is the only fortune worth finding.
txt_cn: 生活的目标，是唯一值得我们去寻找的财富。
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

txt_en: Promise yourself to be so strong that nothing can disturb your peace of mind.
txt_cn: 对自己承诺：要强大到任何事情都无法破坏你内心的平和。 ​​​​
author: Christian D. Larson

txt_en: We are the hero of our own story.
txt_cn: 我们都是我们自己故事里的英雄。
author: Mary McCarthy

txt_en: I'll let you be in my dreams if I can be in yours.
txt_cn: 如果我能进入你的梦乡，我也会把你拥入我的梦里。
author: Bob Dylan

txt_en: Money is better than poverty, if only for financial reasons.
txt_cn: 钱比贫穷更好，如果仅仅因为经济原因的话。
author: Woody Allen

txt_en: When you have eliminated the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.
txt_cn: 当你排除掉了所有的不可能，剩下的无论多么说不通，它都一定是真相。
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

txt_en: Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint.
txt_cn: 读健康类书籍可得小心！你可能会因为一点印刷错误丢了性命。
author: Mark Twain

txt_en: Never explain — your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.
txt_cn: 不用解释——你的朋友不需要，而你的敌人如何也不相信。
author: Elbert Hubbard

txt_en: A good novel tells us the truth about its hero; but a bad novel tells us the truth about its author.
txt_cn: 一本好的小说告诉我们关于主角的种种真相；而一本糟糕的小说告诉我们关于作家自己的种种真相。
author: G. K. Chesterton

txt_en: Everyone is necessarily the hero of his own life story.
txt_cn: 每个人都必定是自己人生故事中的主角。
author: John Barth

txt_en: Famous remarks are very seldom quoted correctly.
txt_cn: 名言很少能被正确引用。
author: Simeon Strunsky

txt_en: Food is the most primitive form of comfort.
txt_cn: 食物是最原始的安慰人心的东西。
author: Sheila Graham

txt_en: Well-timed silence has more eloquence than speech.
txt_cn: 时机恰当的沉默比话语更有说服力。
author: Martin Fraquhar Tupper

txt_en: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
txt_cn: 生命中最重要的两天，是你出生的那一天，和你弄清楚为何而生的那一天。
author: Mark Twain

txt_en: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
txt_cn: 时尚是一种无法容忍的丑陋，以至于我们每六个月就得改变它一次。
author: Oscar Wilde
